00055 static struct cfs_hash_ops uuid_hash_ops;
00056 static struct cfs_hash_ops nid_hash_ops;
00057 static struct cfs_hash_ops nid_stat_hash_ops;
00058 static struct cfs_hash_ops gen_hash_ops;

00060 /*********** string parsing utils *********/
00061 
00062 /* returns 0 if we find this key in the buffer, else 1 */
00063 int class_find_param(char *buf, char *key, char **valp)
00064 {
00065         char *ptr;
00066 
00067         if (!buf)
00068                 return 1;
00069 
00070         if ((ptr = strstr(buf, key)) == NULL)
00071                 return 1;
00072 
00073         if (valp)
00074                 *valp = ptr + strlen(key);
00075 
00076         return 0;
00077 }
00078 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_find_param);
00079 
00095 struct cfg_interop_param *class_find_old_param(const char *param,
00096                                                struct cfg_interop_param *ptr)
00097 {
00098         char *value = NULL;
00099         int   name_len = 0;
00100 
00101         if (param == NULL || ptr == NULL)
00102                 RETURN(NULL);
00103 
00104         value = strchr(param, '=');
00105         if (value == NULL)
00106                 name_len = strlen(param);
00107         else
00108                 name_len = value - param;
00109 
00110         while (ptr->old_param != NULL) {
00111                 if (strncmp(param, ptr->old_param, name_len) == 0 &&
00112                     name_len == strlen(ptr->old_param))
00113                         RETURN(ptr);
00114                 ptr++;
00115         }
00116 
00117         RETURN(NULL);
00118 }
00119 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_find_old_param);
00120 
00137 int class_get_next_param(char **params, char *copy)
00138 {
00139         char *q1, *q2, *str;
00140         int len;
00141 
00142         str = *params;
00143         while (*str == ' ')
00144                 str++;
00145 
00146         if (*str == '\0') {
00147                 *params = NULL;
00148                 return 1;
00149         }
00150 
00151         while (1) {
00152                 q1 = strpbrk(str, " '\"");
00153                 if (q1 == NULL) {
00154                         len = strlen(str);
00155                         memcpy(copy, str, len);
00156                         copy[len] = '\0';
00157                         *params = NULL;
00158                         return 0;
00159                 }
00160                 len = q1 - str;
00161                 if (*q1 == ' ') {
00162                         memcpy(copy, str, len);
00163                         copy[len] = '\0';
00164                         *params = str + len;
00165                         return 0;
00166                 }
00167 
00168                 memcpy(copy, str, len);
00169                 copy += len;
00170 
00171                 /* search for the matching closing quote */
00172                 str = q1 + 1;
00173                 q2 = strchr(str, *q1);
00174                 if (q2 == NULL) {
00175                         CERROR("Unbalanced quota in parameters: \"%s\"\n",
00176                                *params);
00177                         return -EINVAL;
00178                 }
00179                 len = q2 - str;
00180                 memcpy(copy, str, len);
00181                 copy += len;
00182                 str = q2 + 1;
00183         }
00184         return 1;
00185 }
00186 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_get_next_param);
00187 
00188 /* returns 0 if this is the first key in the buffer, else 1.
00189    valp points to first char after key. */
00190 int class_match_param(char *buf, const char *key, char **valp)
00191 {
00192         if (!buf)
00193                 return 1;
00194 
00195         if (memcmp(buf, key, strlen(key)) != 0)
00196                 return 1;
00197 
00198         if (valp)
00199                 *valp = buf + strlen(key);
00200 
00201         return 0;
00202 }
00203 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_match_param);
00204 
00205 static int parse_nid(char *buf, void *value, int quiet)
00206 {
00207         lnet_nid_t *nid = (lnet_nid_t *)value;
00208 
00209         *nid = libcfs_str2nid(buf);
00210         if (*nid != LNET_NID_ANY)
00211                 return 0;
00212 
00213         if (!quiet)
00214                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x159, "Can't parse NID '%s'\n", buf);
00215         return -EINVAL;
00216 }
00217 
00218 static int parse_net(char *buf, void *value)
00219 {
00220         __u32 *net = (__u32 *)value;
00221 
00222         *net = libcfs_str2net(buf);
00223         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Net %s\n", libcfs_net2str(*net));
00224         return 0;
00225 }
00226 
00227 enum {
00228         CLASS_PARSE_NID = 1,
00229         CLASS_PARSE_NET,
00230 };
00231 
00232 /* 0 is good nid,
00233    1 not found
00234    < 0 error
00235    endh is set to next separator */
00236 static int class_parse_value(char *buf, int opc, void *value, char **endh,
00237                              int quiet)
00238 {
00239         char *endp;
00240         char  tmp;
00241         int   rc = 0;
00242 
00243         if (!buf)
00244                 return 1;
00245         while (*buf == ',' || *buf == ':')
00246                 buf++;
00247         if (*buf == ' ' || *buf == '/' || *buf == '\0')
00248                 return 1;
00249 
00250         /* nid separators or end of nids */
00251         endp = strpbrk(buf, ",: /");
00252         if (endp == NULL)
00253                 endp = buf + strlen(buf);
00254 
00255         tmp = *endp;
00256         *endp = '\0';
00257         switch (opc) {
00258         default:
00259                 LBUG();
00260         case CLASS_PARSE_NID:
00261                 rc = parse_nid(buf, value, quiet);
00262                 break;
00263         case CLASS_PARSE_NET:
00264                 rc = parse_net(buf, value);
00265                 break;
00266         }
00267         *endp = tmp;
00268         if (rc != 0)
00269                 return rc;
00270         if (endh)
00271                 *endh = endp;
00272         return 0;
00273 }
00274 
00275 int class_parse_nid(char *buf, lnet_nid_t *nid, char **endh)
00276 {
00277         return class_parse_value(buf, CLASS_PARSE_NID, (void *)nid, endh, 0);
00278 }
00279 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_parse_nid);
00280 
00281 int class_parse_nid_quiet(char *buf, lnet_nid_t *nid, char **endh)
00282 {
00283         return class_parse_value(buf, CLASS_PARSE_NID, (void *)nid, endh, 1);
00284 }
00285 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_parse_nid_quiet);
00286 
00287 int class_parse_net(char *buf, __u32 *net, char **endh)
00288 {
00289         return class_parse_value(buf, CLASS_PARSE_NET, (void *)net, endh, 0);
00290 }
00291 
00292 /* 1 param contains key and match
00293  * 0 param contains key and not match
00294  * -1 param does not contain key
00295  */
00296 int class_match_nid(char *buf, char *key, lnet_nid_t nid)
00297 {
00298         lnet_nid_t tmp;
00299         int   rc = -1;
00300 
00301         while (class_find_param(buf, key, &buf) == 0) {
00302                 /* please restrict to the nids pertaining to
00303                  * the specified nids */
00304                 while (class_parse_nid(buf, &tmp, &buf) == 0) {
00305                         if (tmp == nid)
00306                                 return 1;
00307                 }
00308                 rc = 0;
00309         }
00310         return rc;
00311 }
00312 
00313 int class_match_net(char *buf, char *key, __u32 net)
00314 {
00315         __u32 tmp;
00316         int   rc = -1;
00317 
00318         while (class_find_param(buf, key, &buf) == 0) {
00319                 /* please restrict to the nids pertaining to
00320                  * the specified networks */
00321                 while (class_parse_net(buf, &tmp, &buf) == 0) {
00322                         if (tmp == net)
00323                                 return 1;
00324                 }
00325                 rc = 0;
00326         }
00327         return rc;
00328 }

00330 /********************** class fns **********************/
00331 
00336 int class_attach(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00337 {
00338         struct obd_device *obd = NULL;
00339         char *typename, *name, *uuid;
00340         int rc, len;
00341         ENTRY;
00342 
00343         if (!LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1)) {
00344                 CERROR("No type passed!\n");
00345                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00346         }
00347         typename = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00348 
00349         if (!LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 0)) {
00350                 CERROR("No name passed!\n");
00351                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00352         }
00353         name = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0);
00354 
00355         if (!LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 2)) {
00356                 CERROR("No UUID passed!\n");
00357                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00358         }
00359         uuid = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2);
00360 
00361         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "attach type %s name: %s uuid: %s\n",
00362                MKSTR(typename), MKSTR(name), MKSTR(uuid));
00363 
00364         obd = class_newdev(typename, name);
00365         if (IS_ERR(obd)) {
00366                 /* Already exists or out of obds */
00367                 rc = PTR_ERR(obd);
00368                 obd = NULL;
00369                 CERROR("Cannot create device %s of type %s : %d\n",
00370                        name, typename, rc);
00371                 GOTO(out, rc);
00372         }
00373         LASSERTF(obd != NULL, "Cannot get obd device %s of type %s\n",
00374                  name, typename);
00375         LASSERTF(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC,
00376                  "obd %p obd_magic %08X != %08X\n",
00377                  obd, obd->obd_magic, OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00378         LASSERTF(strncmp(obd->obd_name, name, strlen(name)) == 0,
00379                  "%p obd_name %s != %s\n", obd, obd->obd_name, name);
00380 
00381         rwlock_init(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00382         obd->obd_pool_limit = 0;
00383         obd->obd_pool_slv = 0;
00384 
00385         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_exports);
00386         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_unlinked_exports);
00387         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_delayed_exports);
00388         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_exports_timed);
00389         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_nid_stats);
00390         spin_lock_init(&obd->obd_nid_lock);
00391         spin_lock_init(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00392         mutex_init(&obd->obd_dev_mutex);
00393         spin_lock_init(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
00394         /* obd->obd_osfs_age must be set to a value in the distant
00395          * past to guarantee a fresh statfs is fetched on mount. */
00396         obd->obd_osfs_age = cfs_time_shift_64(-1000);
00397 
00398         /* XXX belongs in setup not attach  */
00399         init_rwsem(&obd->obd_observer_link_sem);
00400         /* recovery data */
00401         cfs_init_timer(&obd->obd_recovery_timer);
00402         spin_lock_init(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
00403         init_waitqueue_head(&obd->obd_next_transno_waitq);
00404         init_waitqueue_head(&obd->obd_evict_inprogress_waitq);
00405         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue);
00406         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue);
00407         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_final_req_queue);
00408         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_evict_list);
00409         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd->obd_lwp_list);
00410 
00411         llog_group_init(&obd->obd_olg);
00412 
00413         obd->obd_conn_inprogress = 0;
00414 
00415         len = strlen(uuid);
00416         if (len >= sizeof(obd->obd_uuid)) {
00417                 CERROR("uuid must be < %d bytes long\n",
00418                        (int)sizeof(obd->obd_uuid));
00419                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00420         }
00421         memcpy(obd->obd_uuid.uuid, uuid, len);
00422 
00423         /* Detach drops this */
00424         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00425         atomic_set(&obd->obd_refcount, 1);
00426         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00427         lu_ref_init(&obd->obd_reference);
00428         lu_ref_add(&obd->obd_reference, "attach", obd);
00429 
00430         obd->obd_attached = 1;
00431         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "OBD: dev %d attached type %s with refcount %d\n",
00432                obd->obd_minor, typename, atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount));
00433         RETURN(0);
00434  out:
00435         if (obd != NULL) {
00436                 class_release_dev(obd);
00437         }
00438         return rc;
00439 }
00440 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_attach);
00441 
00445 int class_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00446 {
00447         int err = 0;
00448         struct obd_export *exp;
00449         ENTRY;
00450 
00451         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00452         LASSERTF(obd == class_num2obd(obd->obd_minor),
00453                  "obd %p != obd_devs[%d] %p\n",
00454                  obd, obd->obd_minor, class_num2obd(obd->obd_minor));
00455         LASSERTF(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC,
00456                  "obd %p obd_magic %08x != %08x\n",
00457                  obd, obd->obd_magic, OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00458 
00459         /* have we attached a type to this device? */
00460         if (!obd->obd_attached) {
00461                 CERROR("Device %d not attached\n", obd->obd_minor);
00462                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00463         }
00464 
00465         if (obd->obd_set_up) {
00466                 CERROR("Device %d already setup (type %s)\n",
00467                        obd->obd_minor, obd->obd_type->typ_name);
00468                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
00469         }
00470 
00471         /* is someone else setting us up right now? (attach inits spinlock) */
00472         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00473         if (obd->obd_starting) {
00474                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00475                 CERROR("Device %d setup in progress (type %s)\n",
00476                        obd->obd_minor, obd->obd_type->typ_name);
00477                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
00478         }
00479         /* just leave this on forever.  I can't use obd_set_up here because
00480            other fns check that status, and we're not actually set up yet. */
00481         obd->obd_starting = 1;
00482         obd->obd_uuid_hash = NULL;
00483         obd->obd_nid_hash = NULL;
00484         obd->obd_nid_stats_hash = NULL;
00485         obd->obd_gen_hash = NULL;
00486         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00487 
00488         /* create an uuid-export lustre hash */
00489         obd->obd_uuid_hash = cfs_hash_create("UUID_HASH",
00490                                              HASH_UUID_CUR_BITS,
00491                                              HASH_UUID_MAX_BITS,
00492                                              HASH_UUID_BKT_BITS, 0,
00493                                              CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00494                                              CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00495                                              &uuid_hash_ops, CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00496         if (!obd->obd_uuid_hash)
00497                 GOTO(err_hash, err = -ENOMEM);
00498 
00499         /* create a nid-export lustre hash */
00500         obd->obd_nid_hash = cfs_hash_create("NID_HASH",
00501                                             HASH_NID_CUR_BITS,
00502                                             HASH_NID_MAX_BITS,
00503                                             HASH_NID_BKT_BITS, 0,
00504                                             CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00505                                             CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00506                                             &nid_hash_ops, CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00507         if (!obd->obd_nid_hash)
00508                 GOTO(err_hash, err = -ENOMEM);
00509 
00510         /* create a nid-stats lustre hash */
00511         obd->obd_nid_stats_hash = cfs_hash_create("NID_STATS",
00512                                                   HASH_NID_STATS_CUR_BITS,
00513                                                   HASH_NID_STATS_MAX_BITS,
00514                                                   HASH_NID_STATS_BKT_BITS, 0,
00515                                                   CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00516                                                   CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00517                                                   &nid_stat_hash_ops, CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00518         if (!obd->obd_nid_stats_hash)
00519                 GOTO(err_hash, err = -ENOMEM);
00520 
00521         /* create a client_generation-export lustre hash */
00522         obd->obd_gen_hash = cfs_hash_create("UUID_HASH",
00523                                             HASH_GEN_CUR_BITS,
00524                                             HASH_GEN_MAX_BITS,
00525                                             HASH_GEN_BKT_BITS, 0,
00526                                             CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00527                                             CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00528                                             &gen_hash_ops, CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00529         if (!obd->obd_gen_hash)
00530                 GOTO(err_hash, err = -ENOMEM);
00531 
00532         exp = class_new_export(obd, &obd->obd_uuid);
00533         if (IS_ERR(exp))
00534                 GOTO(err_hash, err = PTR_ERR(exp));
00535 
00536         obd->obd_self_export = exp;
00537         list_del_init(&exp->exp_obd_chain_timed);
00538         class_export_put(exp);
00539 
00540         err = obd_setup(obd, lcfg);
00541         if (err)
00542                 GOTO(err_exp, err);
00543 
00544         obd->obd_set_up = 1;
00545 
00546         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00547         /* cleanup drops this */
00548         class_incref(obd, "setup", obd);
00549         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00550 
00551         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "finished setup of obd %s (uuid %s)\n",
00552                obd->obd_name, obd->obd_uuid.uuid);
00553 
00554         RETURN(0);
00555 err_exp:
00556         if (obd->obd_self_export) {
00557                 class_unlink_export(obd->obd_self_export);
00558                 obd->obd_self_export = NULL;
00559         }
00560 err_hash:
00561         if (obd->obd_uuid_hash) {
00562                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_uuid_hash);
00563                 obd->obd_uuid_hash = NULL;
00564         }
00565         if (obd->obd_nid_hash) {
00566                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_nid_hash);
00567                 obd->obd_nid_hash = NULL;
00568         }
00569         if (obd->obd_nid_stats_hash) {
00570                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_nid_stats_hash);
00571                 obd->obd_nid_stats_hash = NULL;
00572         }
00573         if (obd->obd_gen_hash) {
00574                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_gen_hash);
00575                 obd->obd_gen_hash = NULL;
00576         }
00577         obd->obd_starting = 0;
00578         CERROR("setup %s failed (%d)\n", obd->obd_name, err);
00579         return err;
00580 }
00581 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_setup);
00582 
00586 int class_detach(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00587 {
00588         ENTRY;
00589 
00590         if (obd->obd_set_up) {
00591                 CERROR("OBD device %d still set up\n", obd->obd_minor);
00592                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
00593         }
00594 
00595         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00596         if (!obd->obd_attached) {
00597                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00598                 CERROR("OBD device %d not attached\n", obd->obd_minor);
00599                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00600         }
00601         obd->obd_attached = 0;
00602         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00603 
00604         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "detach on obd %s (uuid %s)\n",
00605                obd->obd_name, obd->obd_uuid.uuid);
00606 
00607         class_decref(obd, "attach", obd);
00608         RETURN(0);
00609 }
00610 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_detach);
00611 
00616 int class_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00617 {
00618         int err = 0;
00619         char *flag;
00620         ENTRY;
00621 
00622         OBD_RACE(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_RECOV_CLIENTS);
00623 
00624         if (!obd->obd_set_up) {
00625                 CERROR("Device %d not setup\n", obd->obd_minor);
00626                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00627         }
00628 
00629         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00630         if (obd->obd_stopping) {
00631                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00632                 CERROR("OBD %d already stopping\n", obd->obd_minor);
00633                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00634         }
00635         /* Leave this on forever */
00636         obd->obd_stopping = 1;
00637         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00638 
00639         /* wait for already-arrived-connections to finish. */
00640         while (obd->obd_conn_inprogress > 0)
00641                 yield();
00642         smp_rmb();
00643 
00644         if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount >= 2 && LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) > 0) {
00645                 for (flag = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1); *flag != 0; flag++)
00646                         switch (*flag) {
00647                         case 'F':
00648                                 obd->obd_force = 1;
00649                                 break;
00650                         case 'A':
00651                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Failing over %s\n",
00652                                               obd->obd_name);
00653                                 obd->obd_fail = 1;
00654                                 obd->obd_no_transno = 1;
00655                                 obd->obd_no_recov = 1;
00656                                 if (OBP(obd, iocontrol)) {
00657                                         obd_iocontrol(OBD_IOC_SYNC,
00658                                                       obd->obd_self_export,
00659                                                       0, NULL, NULL);
00660                                 }
00661                                 break;
00662                         default:
00663                                 CERROR("Unrecognised flag '%c'\n", *flag);
00664                         }
00665         }
00666 
00667         LASSERT(obd->obd_self_export);
00668 
00669         /* The three references that should be remaining are the
00670          * obd_self_export and the attach and setup references. */
00671         if (atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount) > 3) {
00672                 /* refcounf - 3 might be the number of real exports
00673                    (excluding self export). But class_incref is called
00674                    by other things as well, so don't count on it. */
00675                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "%s: forcing exports to disconnect: %d\n",
00676                        obd->obd_name, atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount) - 3);
00677                 dump_exports(obd, 0);
00678                 class_disconnect_exports(obd);
00679         }
00680 
00681         /* Precleanup, we must make sure all exports get destroyed. */
00682         err = obd_precleanup(obd);
00683         if (err)
00684                 CERROR("Precleanup %s returned %d\n",
00685                        obd->obd_name, err);
00686 
00687         /* destroy an uuid-export hash body */
00688         if (obd->obd_uuid_hash) {
00689                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_uuid_hash);
00690                 obd->obd_uuid_hash = NULL;
00691         }
00692 
00693         /* destroy a nid-export hash body */
00694         if (obd->obd_nid_hash) {
00695                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_nid_hash);
00696                 obd->obd_nid_hash = NULL;
00697         }
00698 
00699         /* destroy a nid-stats hash body */
00700         if (obd->obd_nid_stats_hash) {
00701                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_nid_stats_hash);
00702                 obd->obd_nid_stats_hash = NULL;
00703         }
00704 
00705         /* destroy a client_generation-export hash body */
00706         if (obd->obd_gen_hash) {
00707                 cfs_hash_putref(obd->obd_gen_hash);
00708                 obd->obd_gen_hash = NULL;
00709         }
00710 
00711         class_decref(obd, "setup", obd);
00712         obd->obd_set_up = 0;
00713 
00714         RETURN(0);
00715 }
00716 
00717 struct obd_device *class_incref(struct obd_device *obd,
00718                                 const char *scope, const void *source)
00719 {
00720         lu_ref_add_atomic(&obd->obd_reference, scope, source);
00721         atomic_inc(&obd->obd_refcount);
00722         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "incref %s (%p) now %d\n", obd->obd_name, obd,
00723                atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount));
00724 
00725         return obd;
00726 }
00727 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_incref);
00728 
00729 void class_decref(struct obd_device *obd, const char *scope, const void *source)
00730 {
00731         int err;
00732         int refs;
00733 
00734         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00735         atomic_dec(&obd->obd_refcount);
00736         refs = atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount);
00737         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00738         lu_ref_del(&obd->obd_reference, scope, source);
00739 
00740         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Decref %s (%p) now %d\n", obd->obd_name, obd, refs);
00741 
00742         if ((refs == 1) && obd->obd_stopping) {
00743                 /* All exports have been destroyed; there should
00744                    be no more in-progress ops by this point.*/
00745 
00746                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_self_export->exp_lock);
00747                 obd->obd_self_export->exp_flags |= exp_flags_from_obd(obd);
00748                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_self_export->exp_lock);
00749 
00750                 /* note that we'll recurse into class_decref again */
00751                 class_unlink_export(obd->obd_self_export);
00752                 return;
00753         }
00754 
00755         if (refs == 0) {
00756                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "finishing cleanup of obd %s (%s)\n",
00757                        obd->obd_name, obd->obd_uuid.uuid);
00758                 LASSERT(!obd->obd_attached);
00759                 if (obd->obd_stopping) {
00760                         /* If we're not stopping, we were never set up */
00761                         err = obd_cleanup(obd);
00762                         if (err)
00763                                 CERROR("Cleanup %s returned %d\n",
00764                                        obd->obd_name, err);
00765                 }
00766 
00767                 class_release_dev(obd);
00768         }
00769 }
00770 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_decref);
00771 
00775 int class_add_conn(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00776 {
00777         struct obd_import *imp;
00778         struct obd_uuid uuid;
00779         int rc;
00780         ENTRY;
00781 
00782         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) < 1 ||
00783             LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) > sizeof(struct obd_uuid)) {
00784                 CERROR("invalid conn_uuid\n");
00785                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00786         }
00787         if (strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) &&
00788             strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) &&
00789             strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME) &&
00790             strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME) &&
00791             strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MGC_NAME)) {
00792                 CERROR("can't add connection on non-client dev\n");
00793                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00794         }
00795 
00796         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00797         if (!imp) {
00798                 CERROR("try to add conn on immature client dev\n");
00799                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00800         }
00801 
00802         obd_str2uuid(&uuid, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00803         rc = obd_add_conn(imp, &uuid, lcfg->lcfg_num);
00804 
00805         RETURN(rc);
00806 }
00807 
00810 static int class_del_conn(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00811 {
00812         struct obd_import *imp;
00813         struct obd_uuid uuid;
00814         int rc;
00815         ENTRY;
00816 
00817         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) < 1 ||
00818             LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) > sizeof(struct obd_uuid)) {
00819                 CERROR("invalid conn_uuid\n");
00820                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00821         }
00822         if (strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) &&
00823             strcmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME)) {
00824                 CERROR("can't del connection on non-client dev\n");
00825                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00826         }
00827 
00828         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00829         if (!imp) {
00830                 CERROR("try to del conn on immature client dev\n");
00831                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00832         }
00833 
00834         obd_str2uuid(&uuid, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00835         rc = obd_del_conn(imp, &uuid);
00836 
00837         RETURN(rc);
00838 }
00839 
00840 static struct list_head lustre_profile_list =
00841         LIST_HEAD_INIT(lustre_profile_list);
00842 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(lustre_profile_list_lock);
00843 
00844 struct lustre_profile *class_get_profile(const char * prof)
00845 {
00846         struct lustre_profile *lprof;
00847 
00848         ENTRY;
00849         spin_lock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00850         list_for_each_entry(lprof, &lustre_profile_list, lp_list) {
00851                 if (!strcmp(lprof->lp_profile, prof)) {
00852                         lprof->lp_refs++;
00853                         spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00854                         RETURN(lprof);
00855                 }
00856         }
00857         spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00858         RETURN(NULL);
00859 }
00860 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_get_profile);
00861 
00866 static int class_add_profile(int proflen, char *prof, int osclen, char *osc,
00867                              int mdclen, char *mdc)
00868 {
00869         struct lustre_profile *lprof;
00870         int err = 0;
00871         ENTRY;
00872 
00873         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Add profile %s\n", prof);
00874 
00875         OBD_ALLOC(lprof, sizeof(*lprof));
00876         if (lprof == NULL)
00877                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00878         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lprof->lp_list);
00879 
00880         LASSERT(proflen == (strlen(prof) + 1));
00881         OBD_ALLOC(lprof->lp_profile, proflen);
00882         if (lprof->lp_profile == NULL)
00883                 GOTO(out, err = -ENOMEM);
00884         memcpy(lprof->lp_profile, prof, proflen);
00885 
00886         LASSERT(osclen == (strlen(osc) + 1));
00887         OBD_ALLOC(lprof->lp_dt, osclen);
00888         if (lprof->lp_dt == NULL)
00889                 GOTO(out, err = -ENOMEM);
00890         memcpy(lprof->lp_dt, osc, osclen);
00891 
00892         if (mdclen > 0) {
00893                 LASSERT(mdclen == (strlen(mdc) + 1));
00894                 OBD_ALLOC(lprof->lp_md, mdclen);
00895                 if (lprof->lp_md == NULL)
00896                         GOTO(out, err = -ENOMEM);
00897                 memcpy(lprof->lp_md, mdc, mdclen);
00898         }
00899 
00900         spin_lock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00901         lprof->lp_refs = 1;
00902         lprof->lp_list_deleted = false;
00903 
00904         list_add(&lprof->lp_list, &lustre_profile_list);
00905         spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00906         RETURN(err);
00907 
00908 out:
00909         if (lprof->lp_md)
00910                 OBD_FREE(lprof->lp_md, mdclen);
00911         if (lprof->lp_dt)
00912                 OBD_FREE(lprof->lp_dt, osclen);
00913         if (lprof->lp_profile)
00914                 OBD_FREE(lprof->lp_profile, proflen);
00915         OBD_FREE(lprof, sizeof(*lprof));
00916         RETURN(err);
00917 }
00918 
00919 void class_del_profile(const char *prof)
00920 {
00921         struct lustre_profile *lprof;
00922         ENTRY;
00923 
00924         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Del profile %s\n", prof);
00925 
00926         lprof = class_get_profile(prof);
00927         if (lprof) {
00928                 spin_lock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00929                 /* because get profile increments the ref counter */
00930                 lprof->lp_refs--;
00931                 list_del(&lprof->lp_list);
00932                 lprof->lp_list_deleted = true;
00933                 spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00934 
00935                 class_put_profile(lprof);
00936         }
00937         EXIT;
00938 }
00939 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_del_profile);
00940 
00941 void class_put_profile(struct lustre_profile *lprof)
00942 {
00943         spin_lock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00944         if ((--lprof->lp_refs) > 0) {
00945                 LASSERT(lprof->lp_refs > 0);
00946                 spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00947                 return;
00948         }
00949         spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00950 
00951         /* confirm not a negative number */
00952         LASSERT(lprof->lp_refs == 0);
00953 
00954         /* At least one class_del_profile/profiles must be called
00955          * on the target profile or lustre_profile_list will corrupt */
00956         LASSERT(lprof->lp_list_deleted);
00957         OBD_FREE(lprof->lp_profile, strlen(lprof->lp_profile) + 1);
00958         OBD_FREE(lprof->lp_dt, strlen(lprof->lp_dt) + 1);
00959         if (lprof->lp_md != NULL)
00960                 OBD_FREE(lprof->lp_md, strlen(lprof->lp_md) + 1);
00961         OBD_FREE(lprof, sizeof(*lprof));
00962 }
00963 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_put_profile);
00964 
00965 /* COMPAT_146 */
00966 void class_del_profiles(void)
00967 {
00968         struct lustre_profile *lprof, *n;
00969         ENTRY;
00970 
00971         spin_lock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00972         list_for_each_entry_safe(lprof, n, &lustre_profile_list, lp_list) {
00973                 list_del(&lprof->lp_list);
00974                 lprof->lp_list_deleted = true;
00975                 spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00976 
00977                 class_put_profile(lprof);
00978 
00979                 spin_lock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00980         }
00981         spin_unlock(&lustre_profile_list_lock);
00982         EXIT;
00983 }
00984 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_del_profiles);
00985 
00986 static int class_set_global(char *ptr, int val, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00987 {
00988         ENTRY;
00989         if (class_match_param(ptr, PARAM_AT_MIN, NULL) == 0)
00990                 at_min = val;
00991         else if (class_match_param(ptr, PARAM_AT_MAX, NULL) == 0)
00992                 at_max = val;
00993         else if (class_match_param(ptr, PARAM_AT_EXTRA, NULL) == 0)
00994                 at_extra = val;
00995         else if (class_match_param(ptr, PARAM_AT_EARLY_MARGIN, NULL) == 0)
00996                 at_early_margin = val;
00997         else if (class_match_param(ptr, PARAM_AT_HISTORY, NULL) == 0)
00998                 at_history = val;
00999         else if (class_match_param(ptr, PARAM_JOBID_VAR, NULL) == 0)
01000                 strlcpy(obd_jobid_var, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2),
01001                         JOBSTATS_JOBID_VAR_MAX_LEN + 1);
01002         else
01003                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01004 
01005         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "global %s = %d\n", ptr, val);
01006         RETURN(0);
01007 }
01008 
01009 
01010 /* We can't call ll_process_config or lquota_process_config directly because
01011  * it lives in a module that must be loaded after this one. */
01012 static int (*client_process_config)(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg) = NULL;
01013 static int (*quota_process_config)(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg) = NULL;
01014 
01015 void lustre_register_client_process_config(int (*cpc)(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg))
01016 {
01017         client_process_config = cpc;
01018 }
01019 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_register_client_process_config);
01020 
01033 struct lustre_cfg *lustre_cfg_rename(struct lustre_cfg *cfg,
01034                                      const char *new_name)
01035 {
01036         struct lustre_cfg_bufs  *bufs = NULL;
01037         struct lustre_cfg       *new_cfg = NULL;
01038         char                    *param = NULL;
01039         char                    *new_param = NULL;
01040         char                    *value = NULL;
01041         int                      name_len = 0;
01042         int                      new_len = 0;
01043         ENTRY;
01044 
01045         if (cfg == NULL || new_name == NULL)
01046                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
01047 
01048         param = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1);
01049         if (param == NULL)
01050                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
01051 
01052         value = strchr(param, '=');
01053         if (value == NULL)
01054                 name_len = strlen(param);
01055         else
01056                 name_len = value - param;
01057 
01058         new_len = LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(cfg, 1) + strlen(new_name) - name_len;
01059 
01060         OBD_ALLOC(new_param, new_len);
01061         if (new_param == NULL)
01062                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
01063 
01064         strcpy(new_param, new_name);
01065         if (value != NULL)
01066                 strcat(new_param, value);
01067 
01068         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
01069         if (bufs == NULL) {
01070                 OBD_FREE(new_param, new_len);
01071                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
01072         }
01073 
01074         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, NULL);
01075         lustre_cfg_bufs_init(bufs, cfg);
01076         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, new_param);
01077 
01078         new_cfg = lustre_cfg_new(cfg->lcfg_command, bufs);
01079         OBD_FREE(new_param, new_len);
01080         OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
01081         if (new_cfg == NULL)
01082                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
01083 
01084         new_cfg->lcfg_num = cfg->lcfg_num;
01085         new_cfg->lcfg_flags = cfg->lcfg_flags;
01086         new_cfg->lcfg_nid = cfg->lcfg_nid;
01087         new_cfg->lcfg_nal = cfg->lcfg_nal;
01088 
01089         RETURN(new_cfg);
01090 }
01091 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_cfg_rename);
01092 
01093 static int process_param2_config(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01094 {
01095         char *param = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
01096         char *upcall = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2);
01097         char *argv[] = {
01098                 [0] = "/usr/sbin/lctl",
01099                 [1] = "set_param",
01100                 [2] = param,
01101                 [3] = NULL
01102         };
01103         struct timeval  start;
01104         struct timeval  end;
01105         int             rc;
01106         ENTRY;
01107 
01108         /* Add upcall processing here. Now only lctl is supported */
01109         if (strcmp(upcall, LCTL_UPCALL) != 0) {
01110                 CERROR("Unsupported upcall %s\n", upcall);
01111                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01112         }
01113 
01114         do_gettimeofday(&start);
01115         rc = call_usermodehelper(argv[0], argv, NULL, UMH_WAIT_PROC);
01116         do_gettimeofday(&end);
01117 
01118         if (rc < 0) {
01119                 CERROR("lctl: error invoking upcall %s %s %s: rc = %d; "
01120                        "time %ldus\n", argv[0], argv[1], argv[2], rc,
01121                        cfs_timeval_sub(&end, &start, NULL));
01122         } else {
01123                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "lctl: invoked upcall %s %s %s, time %ldus\n",
01124                        argv[0], argv[1], argv[2],
01125                        cfs_timeval_sub(&end, &start, NULL));
01126                        rc = 0;
01127         }
01128 
01129         RETURN(rc);
01130 }
01131 
01132 void lustre_register_quota_process_config(int (*qpc)(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg))
01133 {
01134         quota_process_config = qpc;
01135 }
01136 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_register_quota_process_config);
01137 
01142 int class_process_config(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01143 {
01144         struct obd_device *obd;
01145         int err;
01146 
01147         LASSERT(lcfg && !IS_ERR(lcfg));
01148         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "processing cmd: %x\n", lcfg->lcfg_command);
01149 
01150         /* Commands that don't need a device */
01151         switch(lcfg->lcfg_command) {
01152         case LCFG_ATTACH: {
01153                 err = class_attach(lcfg);
01154                 GOTO(out, err);
01155         }
01156         case LCFG_ADD_UUID: {
01157                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "adding mapping from uuid %s to nid "LPX64
01158                        " (%s)\n", lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
01159                        lcfg->lcfg_nid, libcfs_nid2str(lcfg->lcfg_nid));
01160 
01161                 err = class_add_uuid(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1), lcfg->lcfg_nid);
01162                 GOTO(out, err);
01163         }
01164         case LCFG_DEL_UUID: {
01165                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "removing mappings for uuid %s\n",
01166                        (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount < 2 || LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) == 0)
01167                        ? "<all uuids>" : lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
01168 
01169                 err = class_del_uuid(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
01170                 GOTO(out, err);
01171         }
01172         case LCFG_MOUNTOPT: {
01173                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "mountopt: profile %s osc %s mdc %s\n",
01174                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
01175                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2),
01176                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
01177                 /* set these mount options somewhere, so ll_fill_super
01178                  * can find them. */
01179                 err = class_add_profile(LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1),
01180                                         lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
01181                                         LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 2),
01182                                         lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2),
01183                                         LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 3),
01184                                         lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
01185                 GOTO(out, err);
01186         }
01187         case LCFG_DEL_MOUNTOPT: {
01188                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "mountopt: profile %s\n",
01189                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
01190                 class_del_profile(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
01191                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01192         }
01193         case LCFG_SET_TIMEOUT: {
01194                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "changing lustre timeout from %d to %d\n",
01195                        obd_timeout, lcfg->lcfg_num);
01196                 obd_timeout = max(lcfg->lcfg_num, 1U);
01197                 obd_timeout_set = 1;
01198                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01199         }
01200         case LCFG_SET_LDLM_TIMEOUT: {
01201                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "changing lustre ldlm_timeout from %d to %d\n",
01202                        ldlm_timeout, lcfg->lcfg_num);
01203                 ldlm_timeout = max(lcfg->lcfg_num, 1U);
01204                 if (ldlm_timeout >= obd_timeout)
01205                         ldlm_timeout = max(obd_timeout / 3, 1U);
01206                 ldlm_timeout_set = 1;
01207                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01208         }
01209         case LCFG_SET_UPCALL: {
01210                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x15a, "recovery upcall is deprecated\n");
01211                 /* COMPAT_146 Don't fail on old configs */
01212                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01213         }
01214         case LCFG_MARKER: {
01215                 struct cfg_marker *marker;
01216                 marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
01217                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "marker %d (%#x) %.16s %s\n", marker->cm_step,
01218                        marker->cm_flags, marker->cm_tgtname, marker->cm_comment);
01219                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01220         }
01221         case LCFG_PARAM: {
01222                 char *tmp;
01223                 /* llite has no obd */
01224                 if ((class_match_param(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
01225                                        PARAM_LLITE, NULL) == 0) &&
01226                     client_process_config) {
01227                         err = (*client_process_config)(lcfg);
01228                         GOTO(out, err);
01229                 } else if ((class_match_param(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
01230                                               PARAM_SYS, &tmp) == 0)) {
01231                         /* Global param settings */
01232                         err = class_set_global(tmp, lcfg->lcfg_num, lcfg);
01233                         /*
01234                          * Client or server should not fail to mount if
01235                          * it hits an unknown configuration parameter.
01236                          */
01237                         if (err != 0)
01238                                 CWARN("Ignoring unknown param %s\n", tmp);
01239 
01240                         GOTO(out, err = 0);
01241                 } else if ((class_match_param(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
01242                                               PARAM_QUOTA, &tmp) == 0) &&
01243                            quota_process_config) {
01244                         err = (*quota_process_config)(lcfg);
01245                         GOTO(out, err);
01246                 }
01247 
01248                 break;
01249         }
01250         case LCFG_SET_PARAM: {
01251                 err = process_param2_config(lcfg);
01252                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01253         }
01254         }
01255         /* Commands that require a device */
01256         obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
01257         if (obd == NULL) {
01258                 if (!LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 0))
01259                         CERROR("this lcfg command requires a device name\n");
01260                 else
01261                         CERROR("no device for: %s\n",
01262                                lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
01263 
01264                 GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
01265         }
01266 
01267         switch(lcfg->lcfg_command) {
01268         case LCFG_SETUP: {
01269                 err = class_setup(obd, lcfg);
01270                 GOTO(out, err);
01271         }
01272         case LCFG_DETACH: {
01273                 err = class_detach(obd, lcfg);
01274                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01275         }
01276         case LCFG_CLEANUP: {
01277                 err = class_cleanup(obd, lcfg);
01278                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01279         }
01280         case LCFG_ADD_CONN: {
01281                 err = class_add_conn(obd, lcfg);
01282                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01283         }
01284         case LCFG_DEL_CONN: {
01285                 err = class_del_conn(obd, lcfg);
01286                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01287         }
01288         case LCFG_POOL_NEW: {
01289                 err = obd_pool_new(obd, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2));
01290                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01291         }
01292         case LCFG_POOL_ADD: {
01293                 err = obd_pool_add(obd, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2),
01294                                    lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
01295                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01296         }
01297         case LCFG_POOL_REM: {
01298                 err = obd_pool_rem(obd, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2),
01299                                    lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
01300                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01301         }
01302         case LCFG_POOL_DEL: {
01303                 err = obd_pool_del(obd, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2));
01304                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
01305         }
01306         default: {
01307                 err = obd_process_config(obd, sizeof(*lcfg), lcfg);
01308                 GOTO(out, err);
01309 
01310         }
01311         }
01312 out:
01313         if ((err < 0) && !(lcfg->lcfg_command & LCFG_REQUIRED)) {
01314                 CWARN("Ignoring error %d on optional command %#x\n", err,
01315                       lcfg->lcfg_command);
01316                 err = 0;
01317         }
01318         return err;
01319 }
01320 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_process_config);
01321 
01322 int class_process_proc_param(char *prefix, struct lprocfs_vars *lvars,
01323                              struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, void *data)
01324 {
01325         struct lprocfs_vars *var;
01326         struct file fakefile;
01327         struct seq_file fake_seqfile;
01328         char *key, *sval;
01329         int i, keylen, vallen;
01330         int matched = 0, j = 0;
01331         int rc = 0;
01332         int skip = 0;
01333         ENTRY;
01334 
01335         if (lcfg->lcfg_command != LCFG_PARAM) {
01336                 CERROR("Unknown command: %d\n", lcfg->lcfg_command);
01337                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01338         }
01339 
01340         /* fake a seq file so that var->fops->write can work... */
01341         fakefile.private_data = &fake_seqfile;
01342         fake_seqfile.private = data;
01343         /* e.g. tunefs.lustre --param mdt.group_upcall=foo /r/tmp/lustre-mdt
01344            or   lctl conf_param lustre-MDT0000.mdt.group_upcall=bar
01345            or   lctl conf_param lustre-OST0000.osc.max_dirty_mb=36 */
01346         for (i = 1; i < lcfg->lcfg_bufcount; i++) {
01347                 key = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, i);
01348                 /* Strip off prefix */
01349                 if (class_match_param(key, prefix, &key))
01350                         /* If the prefix doesn't match, return error so we
01351                          * can pass it down the stack */
01352                         RETURN(-ENOSYS);
01353                 sval = strchr(key, '=');
01354                 if (!sval || (*(sval + 1) == 0)) {
01355                         CERROR("Can't parse param %s (missing '=')\n", key);
01356                         /* rc = -EINVAL;        continue parsing other params */
01357                         continue;
01358                 }
01359                 keylen = sval - key;
01360                 sval++;
01361                 vallen = strlen(sval);
01362                 matched = 0;
01363                 j = 0;
01364                 /* Search proc entries */
01365                 while (lvars[j].name) {
01366                         var = &lvars[j];
01367                         if (class_match_param(key, var->name, NULL) == 0 &&
01368                             keylen == strlen(var->name)) {
01369                                 matched++;
01370                                 rc = -EROFS;
01371 
01372                                 if (var->fops && var->fops->write) {
01373                                         mm_segment_t oldfs;
01374                                         oldfs = get_fs();
01375                                         set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
01376                                         rc = (var->fops->write)(&fakefile, sval,
01377                                                                 vallen, NULL);
01378                                         set_fs(oldfs);
01379                                 }
01380                                 break;
01381                         }
01382                         j++;
01383                 }
01384                 if (!matched) {
01385                         CERROR("%.*s: %s unknown param %s\n",
01386                                (int)strlen(prefix) - 1, prefix,
01387                                (char *)lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), key);
01388                         /* rc = -EINVAL;        continue parsing other params */
01389                         skip++;
01390                 } else if (rc < 0) {
01391                         CERROR("%s: error writing proc entry '%s': rc = %d\n",
01392                                prefix, var->name, rc);
01393                         rc = 0;
01394                 } else {
01395                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s.%.*s: Set parameter %.*s=%s\n",
01396                                          lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0),
01397                                          (int)strlen(prefix) - 1, prefix,
01398                                          (int)(sval - key - 1), key, sval);
01399                 }
01400         }
01401 
01402         if (rc > 0)
01403                 rc = 0;
01404         if (!rc && skip)
01405                 rc = skip;
01406         RETURN(rc);
01407 }
01408 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_process_proc_param);
01409 
01410 /*
01411  * Supplemental functions for config logs, it allocates lustre_cfg
01412  * buffers plus initialized llog record header at the beginning.
01413  */
01414 struct llog_cfg_rec *lustre_cfg_rec_new(int cmd, struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs)
01415 {
01416         struct llog_cfg_rec     *lcr;
01417         int                      reclen;
01418 
01419         ENTRY;
01420 
01421         reclen = lustre_cfg_len(bufs->lcfg_bufcount, bufs->lcfg_buflen);
01422         reclen = llog_data_len(reclen) + sizeof(struct llog_rec_hdr) +
01423                  sizeof(struct llog_rec_tail);
01424 
01425         OBD_ALLOC(lcr, reclen);
01426         if (lcr == NULL)
01427                 RETURN(NULL);
01428 
01429         lustre_cfg_init(&lcr->lcr_cfg, cmd, bufs);
01430 
01431         lcr->lcr_hdr.lrh_len = reclen;
01432         lcr->lcr_hdr.lrh_type = OBD_CFG_REC;
01433 
01434         RETURN(lcr);
01435 }
01436 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_cfg_rec_new);
01437 
01438 void lustre_cfg_rec_free(struct llog_cfg_rec *lcr)
01439 {
01440         ENTRY;
01441         OBD_FREE(lcr, lcr->lcr_hdr.lrh_len);
01442         EXIT;
01443 }
01444 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_cfg_rec_free);
01445 
01451 int class_config_llog_handler(const struct lu_env *env,
01452                               struct llog_handle *handle,
01453                               struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
01454 {
01455         struct config_llog_instance *clli = data;
01456         int cfg_len = rec->lrh_len;
01457         char *cfg_buf = (char*) (rec + 1);
01458         int rc = 0;
01459         ENTRY;
01460 
01461         //class_config_dump_handler(handle, rec, data);
01462 
01463         switch (rec->lrh_type) {
01464         case OBD_CFG_REC: {
01465                 struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, *lcfg_new;
01466                 struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
01467                 char *inst_name = NULL;
01468                 int inst_len = 0;
01469                 int inst = 0, swab = 0;
01470 
01471                 lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)cfg_buf;
01472                 if (lcfg->lcfg_version == __swab32(LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION)) {
01473                         lustre_swab_lustre_cfg(lcfg);
01474                         swab = 1;
01475                 }
01476 
01477                 rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(cfg_buf, cfg_len);
01478                 if (rc)
01479                         GOTO(out, rc);
01480 
01481                 /* Figure out config state info */
01482                 if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_MARKER) {
01483                         struct cfg_marker *marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
01484                         lustre_swab_cfg_marker(marker, swab,
01485                                                LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1));
01486                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Marker, inst_flg=%#x mark_flg=%#x\n",
01487                                clli->cfg_flags, marker->cm_flags);
01488                         if (marker->cm_flags & CM_START) {
01489                                 /* all previous flags off */
01490                                 clli->cfg_flags = CFG_F_MARKER;
01491                                 server_name2index(marker->cm_tgtname,
01492                                                   &clli->cfg_lwp_idx, NULL);
01493                                 if (marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP) {
01494                                         clli->cfg_flags |= CFG_F_SKIP;
01495                                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "SKIP #%d\n",
01496                                                marker->cm_step);
01497                                 } else if ((marker->cm_flags & CM_EXCLUDE) ||
01498                                            (clli->cfg_sb &&
01499                                             lustre_check_exclusion(clli->cfg_sb,
01500                                                          marker->cm_tgtname))) {
01501                                         clli->cfg_flags |= CFG_F_EXCLUDE;
01502                                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "EXCLUDE %d\n",
01503                                                marker->cm_step);
01504                                 }
01505                         } else if (marker->cm_flags & CM_END) {
01506                                 clli->cfg_flags = 0;
01507                         }
01508                 }
01509                 /* A config command without a start marker before it is
01510                    illegal (post 146) */
01511                 if (!(clli->cfg_flags & CFG_F_COMPAT146) &&
01512                     !(clli->cfg_flags & CFG_F_MARKER) &&
01513                     (lcfg->lcfg_command != LCFG_MARKER)) {
01514                         CWARN("Config not inside markers, ignoring! "
01515                               "(inst: %p, uuid: %s, flags: %#x)\n",
01516                               clli->cfg_instance,
01517                               clli->cfg_uuid.uuid, clli->cfg_flags);
01518                         clli->cfg_flags |= CFG_F_SKIP;
01519                 }
01520                 if (clli->cfg_flags & CFG_F_SKIP) {
01521                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "skipping %#x\n",
01522                                clli->cfg_flags);
01523                         rc = 0;
01524                         /* No processing! */
01525                         break;
01526                 }
01527 
01528                 /*
01529                  * For interoperability between 1.8 and 2.0,
01530                  * rename "mds" obd device type to "mdt".
01531                  */
01532                 {
01533                         char *typename = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
01534                         char *index = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2);
01535 
01536                         if ((lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ATTACH && typename &&
01537                              strcmp(typename, "mds") == 0)) {
01538                                 CWARN("For 1.8 interoperability, rename obd "
01539                                        "type from mds to mdt\n");
01540                                 typename[2] = 't';
01541                         }
01542                         if ((lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_SETUP && index &&
01543                              strcmp(index, "type") == 0)) {
01544                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "For 1.8 interoperability, "
01545                                        "set this index to '0'\n");
01546                                 index[0] = '0';
01547                                 index[1] = 0;
01548                         }
01549                 }
01550 
01551 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
01552                 /* newer MDS replaces LOV/OSC with LOD/OSP */
01553                 {
01554                         char *typename = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
01555 
01556                         if ((lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ATTACH && typename &&
01557                             strcmp(typename, LUSTRE_LOV_NAME) == 0) &&
01558                             IS_MDT(s2lsi(clli->cfg_sb))) {
01559                                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG,
01560                                        "For 2.x interoperability, rename obd "
01561                                        "type from lov to lod (%s)\n",
01562                                        s2lsi(clli->cfg_sb)->lsi_svname);
01563                                 strcpy(typename, LUSTRE_LOD_NAME);
01564                         }
01565                         if ((lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ATTACH && typename &&
01566                             strcmp(typename, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) == 0) &&
01567                             IS_MDT(s2lsi(clli->cfg_sb))) {
01568                                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG,
01569                                        "For 2.x interoperability, rename obd "
01570                                        "type from osc to osp (%s)\n",
01571                                        s2lsi(clli->cfg_sb)->lsi_svname);
01572                                 strcpy(typename, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME);
01573                         }
01574                 }
01575 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
01576 
01577                 if (clli->cfg_flags & CFG_F_EXCLUDE) {
01578                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "cmd: %x marked EXCLUDED\n",
01579                                lcfg->lcfg_command);
01580                         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD)
01581                                 /* Add inactive instead */
01582                                 lcfg->lcfg_command = LCFG_LOV_ADD_INA;
01583                 }
01584 
01585                 lustre_cfg_bufs_init(&bufs, lcfg);
01586 
01587                 if (clli && clli->cfg_instance &&
01588                     LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 0) > 0){
01589                         inst = 1;
01590                         inst_len = LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 0) +
01591                                    sizeof(clli->cfg_instance) * 2 + 4;
01592                         OBD_ALLOC(inst_name, inst_len);
01593                         if (inst_name == NULL)
01594                                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01595                         sprintf(inst_name, "%s-%p",
01596                                 lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0),
01597                                 clli->cfg_instance);
01598                         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 0, inst_name);
01599                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "cmd %x, instance name: %s\n",
01600                                lcfg->lcfg_command, inst_name);
01601                 }
01602 
01603                 /* we override the llog's uuid for clients, to insure they
01604                 are unique */
01605                 if (clli && clli->cfg_instance != NULL &&
01606                     lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ATTACH) {
01607                         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 2,
01608                                                    clli->cfg_uuid.uuid);
01609                 }
01610                 /*
01611                  * sptlrpc config record, we expect 2 data segments:
01612                  *  [0]: fs_name/target_name,
01613                  *  [1]: rule string
01614                  * moving them to index [1] and [2], and insert MGC's
01615                  * obdname at index [0].
01616                  */
01617                 if (clli && clli->cfg_instance == NULL &&
01618                     lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF) {
01619                         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(&bufs, 2, bufs.lcfg_buf[1],
01620                                             bufs.lcfg_buflen[1]);
01621                         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(&bufs, 1, bufs.lcfg_buf[0],
01622                                             bufs.lcfg_buflen[0]);
01623                         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 0,
01624                                                    clli->cfg_obdname);
01625                 }
01626 
01627                 lcfg_new = lustre_cfg_new(lcfg->lcfg_command, &bufs);
01628                 if (lcfg_new == NULL)
01629                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01630 
01631                 lcfg_new->lcfg_num   = lcfg->lcfg_num;
01632                 lcfg_new->lcfg_flags = lcfg->lcfg_flags;
01633 
01634                 /* XXX Hack to try to remain binary compatible with
01635                  * pre-newconfig logs */
01636                 if (lcfg->lcfg_nal != 0 &&      /* pre-newconfig log? */
01637                     (lcfg->lcfg_nid >> 32) == 0) {
01638                         __u32 addr = (__u32)(lcfg->lcfg_nid & 0xffffffff);
01639 
01640                         lcfg_new->lcfg_nid =
01641                                 LNET_MKNID(LNET_MKNET(lcfg->lcfg_nal, 0), addr);
01642                         CWARN("Converted pre-newconfig NAL %d NID %x to %s\n",
01643                               lcfg->lcfg_nal, addr,
01644                               libcfs_nid2str(lcfg_new->lcfg_nid));
01645                 } else {
01646                         lcfg_new->lcfg_nid = lcfg->lcfg_nid;
01647                 }
01648 
01649                 lcfg_new->lcfg_nal = 0; /* illegal value for obsolete field */
01650 
01651                 rc = class_process_config(lcfg_new);
01652                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg_new);
01653 
01654                 if (inst)
01655                         OBD_FREE(inst_name, inst_len);
01656                 break;
01657         }
01658         default:
01659                 CERROR("Unknown llog record type %#x encountered\n",
01660                        rec->lrh_type);
01661                 break;
01662         }
01663 out:
01664         if (rc) {
01665                 CERROR("%s: cfg command failed: rc = %d\n",
01666                        handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name, rc);
01667                 class_config_dump_handler(NULL, handle, rec, data);
01668         }
01669         RETURN(rc);
01670 }
01671 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_config_llog_handler);
01672 
01673 int class_config_parse_llog(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt,
01674                             char *name, struct config_llog_instance *cfg)
01675 {
01676         struct llog_process_cat_data     cd = {0, 0};
01677         struct llog_handle              *llh;
01678         llog_cb_t                        callback;
01679         int                              rc;
01680         ENTRY;
01681 
01682         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "looking up llog %s\n", name);
01683         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, NULL, name, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01684         if (rc)
01685                 RETURN(rc);
01686 
01687         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01688         if (rc)
01689                 GOTO(parse_out, rc);
01690 
01691         /* continue processing from where we last stopped to end-of-log */
01692         if (cfg) {
01693                 cd.lpcd_first_idx = cfg->cfg_last_idx;
01694                 callback = cfg->cfg_callback;
01695                 LASSERT(callback != NULL);
01696         } else {
01697                 callback = class_config_llog_handler;
01698         }
01699 
01700         cd.lpcd_last_idx = 0;
01701 
01702         rc = llog_process(env, llh, callback, cfg, &cd);
01703 
01704         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Processed log %s gen %d-%d (rc=%d)\n", name,
01705                cd.lpcd_first_idx + 1, cd.lpcd_last_idx, rc);
01706         if (cfg)
01707                 cfg->cfg_last_idx = cd.lpcd_last_idx;
01708 
01709 parse_out:
01710         llog_close(env, llh);
01711         RETURN(rc);
01712 }
01713 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_config_parse_llog);
01714 
01715 static struct lcfg_type_data {
01716         __u32    ltd_type;
01717         char    *ltd_name;
01718         char    *ltd_bufs[4];
01719 } lcfg_data_table[] = {
01720         { LCFG_ATTACH, "attach", { "type", "UUID", "3", "4" } },
01721         { LCFG_DETACH, "detach", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01722         { LCFG_SETUP, "setup", { "UUID", "node", "options", "failout" } },
01723         { LCFG_CLEANUP, "cleanup", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01724         { LCFG_ADD_UUID, "add_uuid", { "node", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01725         { LCFG_DEL_UUID, "del_uuid", { "1", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01726         { LCFG_MOUNTOPT, "new_profile", { "name", "lov", "lmv", "4" }  },
01727         { LCFG_DEL_MOUNTOPT, "del_mountopt", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } , },
01728         { LCFG_SET_TIMEOUT, "set_timeout", { "parameter", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01729         { LCFG_SET_UPCALL, "set_upcall", { "1", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01730         { LCFG_ADD_CONN, "add_conn", { "node", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01731         { LCFG_DEL_CONN, "del_conn", { "1", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01732         { LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD, "add_osc", { "ost", "index", "gen", "UUID" } },
01733         { LCFG_LOV_DEL_OBD, "del_osc", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01734         { LCFG_PARAM, "set_param", { "parameter", "value", "3", "4" } },
01735         { LCFG_MARKER, "marker", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01736         { LCFG_LOG_START, "log_start", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01737         { LCFG_LOG_END, "log_end", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01738         { LCFG_LOV_ADD_INA, "add_osc_inactive", { "1", "2", "3", "4" }  },
01739         { LCFG_ADD_MDC, "add_mdc", { "mdt", "index", "gen", "UUID" } },
01740         { LCFG_DEL_MDC, "del_mdc", { "1", "2", "3", "4" } },
01741         { LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF, "security", { "parameter", "2", "3", "4" } },
01742         { LCFG_POOL_NEW, "new_pool", { "fsname", "pool", "3", "4" }  },
01743         { LCFG_POOL_ADD, "add_pool", { "fsname", "pool", "ost", "4" } },
01744         { LCFG_POOL_REM, "remove_pool", { "fsname", "pool", "ost", "4" } },
01745         { LCFG_POOL_DEL, "del_pool", { "fsname", "pool", "3", "4" } },
01746         { LCFG_SET_LDLM_TIMEOUT, "set_ldlm_timeout",
01747           { "parameter", "2", "3", "4" } },
01748         { 0, NULL, { NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL } }
01749 };
01750 
01751 static struct lcfg_type_data *lcfg_cmd2data(__u32 cmd)
01752 {
01753         int i = 0;
01754 
01755         while (lcfg_data_table[i].ltd_type != 0) {
01756                 if (lcfg_data_table[i].ltd_type == cmd)
01757                         return &lcfg_data_table[i];
01758                 i++;
01759         }
01760         return NULL;
01761 }
01762 
01772 int class_config_yaml_output(struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, char *buf, int size)
01773 {
01774         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)(rec + 1);
01775         char                    *ptr = buf;
01776         char                    *end = buf + size;
01777         int                      rc = 0, i;
01778         struct lcfg_type_data   *ldata;
01779 
01780         LASSERT(rec->lrh_type == OBD_CFG_REC);
01781         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(lcfg, rec->lrh_len);
01782         if (rc < 0)
01783                 return rc;
01784 
01785         ldata = lcfg_cmd2data(lcfg->lcfg_command);
01786         if (ldata == NULL)
01787                 return -ENOTTY;
01788 
01789         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_MARKER)
01790                 return 0;
01791 
01792         /* form YAML entity */
01793         ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, "- { event: %s", ldata->ltd_name);
01794 
01795         if (lcfg->lcfg_flags)
01796                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, ", flags: %#08x",
01797                                 lcfg->lcfg_flags);
01798         if (lcfg->lcfg_num)
01799                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, ", num: %#08x",
01800                                 lcfg->lcfg_num);
01801         if (lcfg->lcfg_nid) {
01802                 char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
01803 
01804                 libcfs_nid2str_r(lcfg->lcfg_nid, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
01805                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, ", nid: %s("LPX64")",
01806                                 nidstr, lcfg->lcfg_nid);
01807         }
01808 
01809         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 0) > 0)
01810                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, ", device: %s",
01811                                 lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
01812 
01813         for (i = 1; i < lcfg->lcfg_bufcount; i++) {
01814                 if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, i) > 0)
01815                         ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, ", %s: %s",
01816                                         ldata->ltd_bufs[i - 1],
01817                                         lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, i));
01818         }
01819 
01820         ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, " }\n");
01821         /* return consumed bytes */
01822         rc = ptr - buf;
01823         return rc;
01824 }
01825 
01831 static int class_config_parse_rec(struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, char *buf, int size)
01832 {
01833         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)(rec + 1);
01834         char                    *ptr = buf;
01835         char                    *end = buf + size;
01836         int                      rc = 0;
01837 
01838         ENTRY;
01839 
01840         LASSERT(rec->lrh_type == OBD_CFG_REC);
01841         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(lcfg, rec->lrh_len);
01842         if (rc < 0)
01843                 RETURN(rc);
01844 
01845         ptr += snprintf(ptr, end-ptr, "cmd=%05x ", lcfg->lcfg_command);
01846         if (lcfg->lcfg_flags)
01847                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end-ptr, "flags=%#08x ",
01848                                 lcfg->lcfg_flags);
01849 
01850         if (lcfg->lcfg_num)
01851                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end-ptr, "num=%#08x ", lcfg->lcfg_num);
01852 
01853         if (lcfg->lcfg_nid) {
01854                 char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
01855 
01856                 libcfs_nid2str_r(lcfg->lcfg_nid, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
01857                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end-ptr, "nid=%s("LPX64")\n     ",
01858                                 nidstr, lcfg->lcfg_nid);
01859         }
01860 
01861         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_MARKER) {
01862                 struct cfg_marker *marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
01863 
01864                 ptr += snprintf(ptr, end-ptr, "marker=%d(%#x)%s '%s'",
01865                                 marker->cm_step, marker->cm_flags,
01866                                 marker->cm_tgtname, marker->cm_comment);
01867         } else {
01868                 int i;
01869 
01870                 for (i = 0; i <  lcfg->lcfg_bufcount; i++) {
01871                         ptr += snprintf(ptr, end-ptr, "%d:%s  ", i,
01872                                         lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, i));
01873                 }
01874         }
01875         ptr += snprintf(ptr, end - ptr, "\n");
01876         /* return consumed bytes */
01877         rc = ptr - buf;
01878         RETURN(rc);
01879 }
01880 
01881 int class_config_dump_handler(const struct lu_env *env,
01882                               struct llog_handle *handle,
01883                               struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
01884 {
01885         char    *outstr;
01886         int      rc = 0;
01887 
01888         ENTRY;
01889 
01890         OBD_ALLOC(outstr, 256);
01891         if (outstr == NULL)
01892                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01893 
01894         if (rec->lrh_type == OBD_CFG_REC) {
01895                 class_config_parse_rec(rec, outstr, 256);
01896                 LCONSOLE(D_WARNING, "   %s\n", outstr);
01897         } else {
01898                 LCONSOLE(D_WARNING, "unhandled lrh_type: %#x\n", rec->lrh_type);
01899                 rc = -EINVAL;
01900         }
01901 
01902         OBD_FREE(outstr, 256);
01903         RETURN(rc);
01904 }
01905 
01909 int class_manual_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
01910 {
01911         char                    flags[3] = "";
01912         struct lustre_cfg      *lcfg;
01913         struct lustre_cfg_bufs  bufs;
01914         int                     rc;
01915         ENTRY;
01916 
01917         if (!obd) {
01918                 CERROR("empty cleanup\n");
01919                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
01920         }
01921 
01922         if (obd->obd_force)
01923                 strcat(flags, "F");
01924         if (obd->obd_fail)
01925                 strcat(flags, "A");
01926 
01927         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Manual cleanup of %s (flags='%s')\n",
01928                obd->obd_name, flags);
01929 
01930         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, obd->obd_name);
01931         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, flags);
01932         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_CLEANUP, &bufs);
01933         if (lcfg == NULL)
01934                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01935 
01936         rc = class_process_config(lcfg);
01937         if (rc) {
01938                 CERROR("cleanup failed %d: %s\n", rc, obd->obd_name);
01939                 GOTO(out, rc);
01940         }
01941 
01942         /* the lcfg is almost the same for both ops */
01943         lcfg->lcfg_command = LCFG_DETACH;
01944         rc = class_process_config(lcfg);
01945         if (rc)
01946                 CERROR("detach failed %d: %s\n", rc, obd->obd_name);
01947 out:
01948         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
01949         RETURN(rc);
01950 }
01951 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_manual_cleanup);

01953 /*
01954  * uuid<->export lustre hash operations
01955  */
01956 
01957 static unsigned
01958 uuid_hash(struct cfs_hash *hs, const void *key, unsigned mask)
01959 {
01960         return cfs_hash_djb2_hash(((struct obd_uuid *)key)->uuid,
01961                                   sizeof(((struct obd_uuid *)key)->uuid), mask);
01962 }
01963 
01964 static void *
01965 uuid_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
01966 {
01967         struct obd_export *exp;
01968 
01969         exp = hlist_entry(hnode, struct obd_export, exp_uuid_hash);
01970 
01971         return &exp->exp_client_uuid;
01972 }
01973 
01974 /*
01975  * NOTE: It is impossible to find an export that is in failed
01976  *       state with this function
01977  */
01978 static int
01979 uuid_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
01980 {
01981         struct obd_export *exp;
01982 
01983         LASSERT(key);
01984         exp = hlist_entry(hnode, struct obd_export, exp_uuid_hash);
01985 
01986         return obd_uuid_equals(key, &exp->exp_client_uuid) &&
01987                !exp->exp_failed;
01988 }
01989 
01990 static void *
01991 uuid_export_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
01992 {
01993         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct obd_export, exp_uuid_hash);
01994 }
01995 
01996 static void
01997 uuid_export_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
01998 {
01999         struct obd_export *exp;
02000 
02001         exp = hlist_entry(hnode, struct obd_export, exp_uuid_hash);
02002         class_export_get(exp);
02003 }
02004 
02005 static void
02006 uuid_export_put_locked(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
02007 {
02008         struct obd_export *exp;
02009 
02010         exp = hlist_entry(hnode, struct obd_export, exp_uuid_hash);
02011         class_export_put(exp);
02012 }
02013

02015         .hs_hash        = uuid_hash,
02016         .hs_key         = uuid_key,
02017         .hs_keycmp      = uuid_keycmp,
02018         .hs_object      = uuid_export_object,
02019         .hs_get         = uuid_export_get,
02020         .hs_put_locked  = uuid_export_put_locked,
02021 };
